intro: Aciphylla divisa, commonly known as the divided spinifex, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted foliage composed of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense heads, typical of the daisy family. It is well adapted to harsh environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils with full sun exposure. Aciphylla divisa is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
